books.title: The Demi-Gods
books.author: James Stephens
books.summary: Three demi-gods descend among humanity in the form of angels, stumbling upon a father, his daughter, and their donkey traveling around rural Ireland.

books.title: Allan Quatermain Stories
books.author: H. Rider Haggard
books.summary: A collection of short stories about a legendary hunter.

books.title: The Story of My Life
books.author: Helen Keller
books.summary: Helen Keller writes about her experiences as a deafblind child learning to communicate.

books.title: The Lives and Opinions of Eminent Philosophers
books.author: Diogenes Laërtius
books.summary: Brief biographies of the prominent philosophers of ancient Greece.

books.title: Peter and Wendy
books.author: J. M. Barrie
books.summary: A mischievous and cocky young boy, Peter Pan, takes Wendy and her brothers on adventures on a fantasy island consisting of mermaids, pirates, Native Americans, and fairies.

books.title: The Small Bachelor
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: A struggling artist and his dream girl set off on a series of comedic misadventures.

books.title: Electra
books.author: Sophocles
books.summary: A woman seeks revenge against her mother for the murder of her father.

books.title: Lud-in-the-Mist
books.author: Hope Mirrlees
books.summary: After more than two hundred years of stability, a sudden surge in contraband fairy fruit threatens the peace and mental heath of citizens in the borderland town of Lud-in-the-Mist.

books.title: Against the Grain
books.author: J.-K. Huysmans
books.summary: Ailing, neurotic, and bored with the world, a French nobleman retreats to a secluded cottage in the countryside to create an artificial paradise for himself.

books.title: The Beetle
books.author: Richard Marsh
books.summary: A group of middle-class Victorians find themselves pitted against an ancient Egyptian evil.

books.title: The Mirror of the Sea
books.author: Joseph Conrad
books.summary: An autobiographical memoir on Joseph Conrad’s maritime experiences and his relationship with the sea.

books.title: The Mystery of the Blue Train
books.author: Agatha Christie
books.summary: A retired detective finds himself at the scene of a murder aboard a French locomotive.

books.title: The Conscience of a Conservative
books.author: Barry Goldwater
books.summary: A U.S. Senator and future presidential nominee outlines key principles of the 20th century American conservative movement.

books.title: Principia Ethica
books.author: G. E. Moore
books.summary: An analysis of the concept of good that diagnoses the history of ethics as being marred by the “naturalistic fallacy” while discussing intrinsic goods and evils.

books.title: Poetry
books.author: James Joyce
books.summary: A collection of James Joyce’s poetry, ordered by date of first publication.

books.title: Zuleika Dobson
books.author: Max Beerbohm
books.summary: A beautiful magician unsuspectingly casts her charms on quiet Oxford.

books.title: The Stainless Steel Rat
books.author: Harry Harrison
books.summary: An intergalactic thief tries life on the side of the law.

books.title: Just So Stories
books.author: Rudyard Kipling
books.summary: A collection of short humorous fables for children, most purporting to tell the origin of animal characteristics such as the camel’s hump.

books.title: Tao Te Ching
books.author: Laozi
books.summary: One of the fundamental texts of the Tao philosophy and religion.

books.title: The Four Men
books.author: Hilaire Belloc
books.summary: Hilaire Belloc takes a pilgrimage across his beloved home English county of Sussex writing as four distinct personalities, with a wide variety of songs, stories, and digressions.
